post: The road to American independence was long and bloody. Our latest A250 Mini Documentary examines the Battle of Bunker Hill, a turning point that showed the true cost of liberty. Join us as we trace the events of that fateful day and its impact on the broader struggle for freedom.  https://bit.ly/4dXDd2q  #AmericanHistory  #A250  #BattleofBunkerHill

Students gathered at Oklahoma State Universitys Tulsa campus last week to make their pitch for funding as part of the Bill of Rights Institutes MyImpact Challenge Civics Fair. Inspired by Tulsas rich history of diverse entrepreneurship, BRI collaborated with Kidvation Global and Tulsa Changemakers for the event, which consisted of students taking part in a hack-a-thon  session. They worked to develop a solution to a problem in their local communities and made a pitch  for funding that same day, while using the constitutional principles central to the contest. Read our latest blog for more!  https://lnkd.in/evrpz34W

Our affiliate partner, Federal Flags, LLC, makes Heavy-Duty Outdoor Nylon American Flags and both commercial and residential flagpoles. All products are made in the USA. When you shop with them and use the code 'BRI5' at checkout, they will return a portion of your purchase to us. Shop today!  https://bit.ly/3z2vhMW

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Angelica Bautista! Angelica is a high school senior from Brownsville, Texas. She plans to attend college and double major in Political Science and Philosophy before attending law school. In her free time, Angelica enjoys reading, dancing, writing, and making music. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Teachers! Participate in the Civic Star Challenge and celebrate 250 years of American independence this upcoming school year! This nationwide opportunity will help you bring the ideals of the Declaration of Independence to life in your classroom. Open to K–12 educators who desire to spark creativity, discovery, and civic engagement. Don't miss this chance to win exciting prizes throughout the school year! Sign up now and be the first to hear when the Civic Star Challenge launches in August 2025:  https://lnkd.in/eQsPQWCj 🤝 @icivics  #CivicLearning  #CivicEducation  #Civics  #iCivics

Today, we recognize The LD Expert Stephanie Tsapakis, M. A., WDT and Chelsea DiMarzio, M. A. CCC-SLP, WDP as a Civics for Everyone Heroesbecause they dont just support students with learning differences, they amplify them.  https://www.ldexpert.org/ In a world where too many learners are underestimated or overlooked, The LD Expert is giving students the tools - and the belief - to step forward, speak up, and lead. Using their expertise in learning disabilities, they work to empower students with strategies for comprehension and communication and have a deep commitment to making civic learning truly accessible. Their services ensure that students with learning differences receive the necessary support to actively engage in civic education by enhancing their communication skills, reading abilities, and participation in classroom discussions. Find out more about our Civics for Everyone initiative.  https://bit.ly/4jBYuQp  #CivicsForEveryone  #LDExpert  #LearningDifferences  #Neurodiversity  #StudentVoice  #SpecialEducation  #CivicEngagement  #EducationForAll  #NoLimits  #EdEquity  #DisabilityInclusion  #BRI  #AccessibilityChampions  #UnlockPotential  #LeadWithConfidence

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Brianna Blair! Brianna is a high school junior from Goodyear, Arizona. She is very excited to be a BRI Student Fellow! With a passion for civic education, she believes in increasing representation in government and politics. She founded a youth organization, HerGov, to increase the number of young women entering the public policy sphere. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Interested in learning about our approach to teaching civics? Chief Program Officer Stan Swim explores how we seek to teach it in a way that is effective, unique, and relevant to students and educators today. Instead of focusing solely on the structure and function of government, BRI teaches young people to engage in the institutions of civil society, like businesses, charities, and community groups, to solve problems and pursue opportunities. Watch the video today!  https://lnkd.in/e8CMY-jj

Today, June 6, marks the anniversary of Allied forces landing in Northern France, beginning what they hoped would bring about the destruction of the German war machine, the elimination of Nazi tyranny over the oppressed peoples of Europe....  Dwight D. Eisenhower was the Supreme Commander of Allied forces. In preparation for the invasion, he crafted a statement for the general public in the event the landings failed. Explore this lesson and learn about how Eisenhower's actions exemplified the civic virtue of responsibility in leading the Allied forces.  https://bit.ly/4mEeoMR

Are you planning summer travel? Did you know you can support BRI while you travel? Through our partnership with  https://bit.ly/4jtFt2v, every travel purchase you make can help support our civic mission. Book your new flight, rental car, or hotel stay through our website and give back to the Institute!  https://bit.ly/43XWUUk
